interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/09/23
Average Rating: 3.2
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lee Schloss'], 'Producers': ['Mike Bocchetti'], 'Starring': ['Mike Bocchetti', 'Artie Lange', 'Sal the Stockbroker']}
Review Text: The quality of the video could be better, but the quality of Mike could not. He's got a heart of gold, and if you want to see who he is, I recommend youtubing "Mike Bocchetti and the weather". Crisp video quality, and Mike never has a bad word to say about anyone. His true comic talents are brought out by Artie Lange on Artie's show when he does the weather. Please watch, I've seen it so many times.
Review Title: Mike is a 5 star person
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

I got this movie to watch with my mom because she grew up on the East Coast around this time. It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material, not too much, but all in all a nice escape, and a movie that stands up to rewatching.
It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Henry Singer'], 'Producers': ['Henry Singer'], 'Studio': ['XiveTV']}
They should retitle this one "The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs". This guy tried to make the entire story about him, a guy who pushed a button on a machine. Line after line of how he was Picasso, how his photograph compared to Pulitzer Prize winning photos, every last thing the guy said was about himself. I defy you to find a sentence without the word "I" or "me" in it.
The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs

Out after 40 seconds. I at first couldn't realize if the video was warped, or the guy had a speech impediment. No way could I make it through 90 minutes of that.
Out after 40 seconds. I at first couldn't realize ...
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['None'], 'Starring': ['Ruth Blackwell'], 'Studio': ['Independent Documentary']}
Water faucets running and junk scattered on the floor. That HAD to be a ghost! I now believe in ghosts! This was a lower budget Blair Witch Project that was hoping a large percentage of the people were too young to remember The Blair Witch Project. The only reason it barely made it to three stars is that it's a cute couple. And they did get me to watch the whole thing. This was very terrible.
This was very terrible.

The quality of the video could be better, but the quality of Mike could not. He's got a heart of gold, and if you want to see who he is, I recommend youtubing "Mike Bocchetti and the weather". Crisp video quality, and Mike never has a bad word to say about anyone. His true comic talents are brought out by Artie Lange on Artie's show when he does the weather. Please watch, I've seen it so many times.
Mike is a 5 star person
profile:
**User Summary:**

The user maintains a strong affinity for comedy films that incorporate elements of drama and nostalgia, emphasizing narratives rich in personal connections and cultural experiences. Their discerning taste reveals a clear preference for balanced storytelling and in-depth character exploration, coupled with a notable aversion to self-absorbed protagonists. 

Recent interactions have highlighted a growing intolerance for subpar execution in filmmaking, indicating exacting standards for emotional engagement and narrative clarity. This trend is evident in their critical stance on projects perceived as lacking coherence, despite recognizing redeeming qualities, such as the charm of lead characters.

The user's appreciation for nuanced storytelling continues to be supported by their engagement with multi-language audio and subtitles, reinforcing a commitment to accessible narratives. Their feedback style remains balanced, concentrating on emotional impact and entertainment value, but they are increasingly less forgiving of poorly executed content.

A recent interaction showcasing enthusiasm for a talented individual in a comedic context emphasizes their recognition of authenticity and genuine character in performance, evidenced by a glowing review despite overall production shortcomings. This reflects an evolving perspective that values the heartfelt contributions of individuals in the entertainment sphere while maintaining high standards for quality.

Overall, this profile illustrates a sophisticated viewer who prizes quality storytelling and character development, seeking films that offer warmth and nuanced explorations of complex themes, with an increasing demand for coherence and execution in their cinematic choices.
